requirement_tested: A dashboard interface displaying regulatory policies with data visualization capabilities
user_persona: A policy analyst named Sarah who needs to quickly assess the landscape of current regulations.
user_goal: To view a summary of regulatory policies along with visual charts depicting their distribution.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the dashboard and expects to see an overview of policies alongside data visualizations.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page loads with a lavender background, indigo header, and displays policy cards with interactive charts above them.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Policy Card
narrative_steps.description: Sarah sees a policy card that interests her and clicks on it to get more details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a policy card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the detailed policy view page showing full information about the selected policy.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Chart Tooltips
narrative_steps.description: While reviewing the dashboard, Sarah hovers over elements of the chart to gain deeper insights.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over chart elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip appears displaying additional data points related to the hovered segment.

requirement_tested: Support for browsing and analyzing different regulatory policies
user_persona: A compliance officer named James tasked with auditing applicable policies.
user_goal: To efficiently browse through various regulatory policies using available filters and search.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: James wants to narrow down the list of policies by selecting specific categories from the filter panel.
narrative_steps.action: Click checkboxes in the filter panel under Category section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Policy listing updates immediately to show only those matching the selected categories without reloading the page.

narrative_steps.title: Searching Policies
narrative_steps.description: He recalls part of a policy title and uses the search bar to locate it.
narrative_steps.action: Type keyword into search field and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System retrieves and displays policies whose titles or identifiers match the entered keyword.

narrative_steps.title: Scrolling for More Results
narrative_steps.description: After seeing initial results, James scrolls down to load more policies.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the policy list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional policies are automatically loaded as he reaches the end of the current result set.

requirement_tested: Interactive charts and graphs to represent complex policy data
user_persona: A data scientist named Lisa evaluating policy trends over time.
user_goal: To interact with charts to better understand how policies are distributed and evolve.

narrative_steps.title: Toggling Data Series Visibility
narrative_steps.description: Lisa notices several data series in the chart legend and wants to isolate one for clearer analysis.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a legend item associated with a particular data series.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Corresponding data series in the chart is hidden or shown depending on previous state.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Detailed Values
narrative_steps.description: She moves her cursor over segments of a pie chart to see exact figures.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over segments of the pie chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Pop-up tooltip shows precise numerical values and percentage breakdowns for the hovered segment.

narrative_steps.title: Adjusting Time Scope Dynamically
narrative_steps.description: Wanting to focus on recent enactments, Lisa drags the time range selector to adjust the chart timeframe.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the time range selector handle on the chart timeline.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart updates dynamically to reflect policy data within the newly selected temporal scope.

requirement_tested: Filtering functionality to narrow down displayed policies based on user criteria
user_persona: A legal researcher named Omar looking for environment-related policies.
user_goal: To use filters effectively to isolate relevant environmental policies.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Filter Criteria
narrative_steps.description: Omar selects 'Environment' from the Category filter checkboxes to refine the displayed policies.
narrative_steps.action: Check the 'Environment' checkbox in the Category filter section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Live preview updates showing the number of policies affected, and the main listing reflects the filtered results instantly.

narrative_steps.title: Resetting All Filters
narrative_steps.description: After exploring, Omar decides to remove all applied filters to start fresh.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filters' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All previously selected filters are deselected, and the policy listing returns to its original unfiltered state.

requirement_tested: Sorting options for organizing policies by various attributes
user_persona: A government official named Maria overseeing multiple jurisdictionsâ€™ policies.
user_goal: To organize the policy list by creation date to track newest entries.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Sort Options
narrative_steps.description: Maria looks for a way to sort the policies and finds the 'Sort By' dropdown near the top right.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Sort By' dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown expands revealing a list of sortable fields including 'Created At', 'Title', etc.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Sorting Field
narrative_steps.description: She chooses to sort by 'Created At' to see most recently added policies first.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Created At' from the dropdown options.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Policy list re-fetches and re-renders showing the newest policies at the top.

requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all policy data from backend APIs
user_persona: A developer named Alex testing integration between frontend and backend systems.
user_goal: To confirm that the frontend correctly fetches policy data dynamically from backend APIs.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Page Load
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the dashboard expecting to see real-time data pulled from the backend rather than hardcoded content.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab, then visit the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Network logs show GET requests made to /api/policies endpoint, retrieving actual data instead of static placeholders.

requirement_tested: Backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A DevOps engineer named Chen responsible for deploying backend services securely.
user_goal: To verify that the backend properly connects to PostgreSQL using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Chen deploys the backend locally and ensures it initializes connection to the PostgreSQL database.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server process with correct environment variables configured.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL database using host=localhost, port=5432, and provided credentials.

requirement_tested: Database schema design to store regulatory policy information and related metadata
user_persona: A database administrator named Dana setting up the schema for storing regulatory policies.
user_goal: To validate that the database has been created with appropriate tables and relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Table Structures
narrative_steps.description: Dana connects to the PostgreSQL instance to inspect whether required tables exist and are structured correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Run SQL command to describe tables: policies, policy_metadata, and policy_attachments.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returned schema matches documented definitions with proper primary keys, foreign keys, and column types.

requirement_tested: UI styling with lavender background color and indigo-colored UI elements
user_persona: A UX designer named Riley ensuring brand consistency across the platform.
user_goal: To verify that the color scheme aligns with branding guidelines.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Riley inspects the dashboard visually and via browser dev tools to confirm the background color.
narrative_steps.action: Use browser inspection tool to check the background color of the body element.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background color is confirmed as lavender (#E6E6FA).

narrative_steps.title: Validating UI Element Colors
narrative_steps.description: Next, she checks if interactive components like buttons and headers utilize indigo coloring.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect header navigation bar and buttons for color values.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: UI elements such as headers and buttons display indigo color (#4B0082).

requirement_tested: Responsive layout ensuring usability across desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: A remote worker named Taylor accessing the dashboard from both office PC and smartphone.
user_goal: To ensure seamless usability regardless of device used.

narrative_steps.title: Desktop Experience
narrative_steps.description: Taylor accesses the dashboard from a desktop computer and expects a multi-column layout.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate desktop resolution and observe layout.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout presents multiple columns of policy cards with filters aligned vertically on the left side.

narrative_steps.title: Mobile Responsiveness
narrative_steps.description: Later, Taylor switches to a mobile phone and checks for optimized layout.
narrative_steps.action: Access dashboard using a simulated mobile viewport (e.g., Chrome DevTools mobile mode).
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Content stacks into a single column with larger touch targets suitable for finger tapping.

requirement_tested: Search bar for users to find specific policies by keyword or identifier
user_persona: A junior associate named Jordan needing to find a specific regulation quickly.
user_goal: To perform a quick search for a known policy using keywords.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Keyword Search
narrative_steps.description: Jordan remembers a phrase from the policy and enters it into the search box.
narrative_steps.action: Enter keyword into the central search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update to show policies containing the keyword, ranked by relevance.

narrative_steps.title: Using Auto-Search Feature
narrative_steps.description: As Jordan continues typing, the system provides instant feedback.
narrative_steps.action: Pause typing mid-query in the search field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: After a short delay, auto-search executes and updates results accordingly.

requirement_tested: Policy detail view showing comprehensive information when a policy is selected
user_persona: A legislative assistant named Emma preparing briefing notes for a meeting.
user_goal: To review all aspects of a selected policy comprehensively.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Between Tabs
narrative_steps.description: Emma clicks through different sections of the policy detail page to gather all necessary info.
narrative_steps.action: Click on tabs labeled Overview, Full Text, Metadata, and Attachments.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each tab loads respective content blocks smoothly without requiring a full page refresh.

requirement_tested: Export functionality allowing users to download policy data or visualizations
user_persona: A report writer named Noah compiling findings for stakeholders.
user_goal: To export policy data in a shareable format.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Export Process
narrative_steps.description: Noah identifies a useful dataset and initiates the export function.
narrative_steps.action: Click the floating export action button located at the lower-right corner.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Context-sensitive menu pops up offering options like 'Download CSV', 'Export Chart Image', and 'Print Summary'.

narrative_steps.title: Downloading Selected Artifact
narrative_steps.description: He opts to download the current chart image for inclusion in his presentation.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Export Chart Image' from the menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A downloadable PNG or SVG file of the chart is generated and offered for saving.

requirement_tested: User authentication system to manage access to sensitive policy information
user_persona: An intern named Zoe who requires access to confidential regulatory materials.
user_goal: To log in and access restricted policy areas securely.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Login Prompt
narrative_steps.description: Zoe attempts to access a protected area which prompts her to authenticate.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to navigate to a restricted policy section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal overlay appears asking for username and password credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Credentials
narrative_steps.description: She fills out the form with valid login details and submits.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid username and password, then click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully logged in and redirected to the originally requested protected resource with session established.

requirement_tested: Configuration of package.json to support `npm run install:all` and `npm run dev` commands
user_persona: A team lead named Marcus guiding new developers through project setup.
user_goal: To streamline local development environment setup with unified scripts.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Marcus instructs the team to install dependencies for both frontend and backend simultaneously.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend node_modules directories are populated with required packages concurrently.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Next, they start both development servers together for integrated debugging.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend development servers launch concurrently, ready for live coding and API testing.
